org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting

Class CombiLayouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting.CombiLayouter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operator, UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LogicalGraph>, UnaryBaseGraphToValueOperator<LogicalGraph,LogicalGraph>, UnaryGraphToGraphOperator, LayoutingAlgorithm

    public class CombiLayouter
extends Object
implements LayoutingAlgorithm
    A layouter that combines the CentroidFRLayouter and the FRLayouter.

      • Fields inherited from interface org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting.LayoutingAlgorithm

    • Constructor Detail

      • CombiLayouter

        public CombiLayouter(int iterations,
                     int numVertices,
                     double quality)
        Create a new CombiLayouter.
        Parameters:
        iterations - Number of iterations to perform
        numVertices - Approximate number of vertices in the input-graph
        quality - Ratio of iterations between the two base algorithms. The higher the value, the more iterations of the FRLayouter are performed. A value of 0.1 is often good enough.

    • Method Detail

      • k

        public CombiLayouter k(double k)
        Set the FRLayouter parameter k for both algorithms, overwriting the default value
        Parameters:
        k - The new value
        Returns:
        this layouter

      • area

        public CombiLayouter area(int width,
                          int height)
        Override default layout-space size Default: width = height = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(k, 2) * numberOfVertices) * 0.5
        Parameters:
        width - new width
        height - new height
        Returns:
        this layouter

      • maxRepulsionDistance

        public CombiLayouter maxRepulsionDistance(int maxRepulsionDistance)
        Override default maxRepulsionDistance of the FR-Algorithm. Vertices with larger distance are ignored in repulsion-force calculation Default-Value is relative to current k. If k is overriden, this is changed accordingly automatically Default: 2k
        Parameters:
        maxRepulsionDistance - new value
        Returns:
        this layouter

      • useExistingLayout

        public CombiLayouter useExistingLayout(boolean useExisting)
        Use the existing layout as starting point instead of creating a random one. If used, EVERY vertex in the input-graph MUST have an X and Y property!
        Parameters:
        useExisting - whether to re-use the existing layout or not
        Returns:
        this layouter

      • getK

        public double getK()
        Gets k. K is the distance in which the attracting and repulsive forces between two connected vertices are equally strong. The value of k influences the scale of the final graph-layout. (A small k leads to vertices being closer together)
        Returns:
        value of k

      • getMaxRepulsionDistance

        public int getMaxRepulsionDistance()
        Gets maxRepulsionDistance
        Returns:
        value of maxRepulsionDistance

      • execute

        public LogicalGraph execute(LogicalGraph g)
        Description copied from interface: LayoutingAlgorithm
        Layouts the given graph. After layouting all vertices will have two new properties: X: the assigned x-coordinate
        Y: the assigned y-coordinate
        Specified by:
        execute in interface UnaryBaseGraphToValueOperator<LogicalGraph,LogicalGraph>
        Specified by:
        execute in interface LayoutingAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to layout
        Returns:
        The input-graph, but every vertex now has X and Y coordinates as properties
